alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Lafayette (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 02 at 8:35PM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 AM EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Big Bend Florida, including the following counties, Jefferson, Lafayette, Madison and Taylor and Georgia, including the following counties, Brooks, Decatur, Grady, Lowndes and Thomas. * WHEN...Until 830 AM EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 834 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms will continue off and on through early Sunday morning. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 3 and 7 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Monticello, Madison, Quitman, Perry, Thomasville, Lake Park, Valdosta, Cairo, Hahira, Boston, Pavo, I-75 At Exit 16, Moody Air Force Base, Remerton, Dasher, Greenville, Morven, Attapulgus, Barwick and Lee. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
